adrFormatAddress: 2315 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA

editorialSummary.text: Retro-chic eatery offering French dip sandwiches, steaks, and other American bites with cocktails.

originalText.text: First experience here and my boyfriend and I loved this place. I came on a Saturday morning and there were lots of people waiting for tables but i had a reservation and the hostess led us right to a table which was nice. Our waitress Sara was lovely, super nice and friendly. I had to mention her because she was so great! The food was pretty good nice sized portions for the price. The hibiscus Bellini was supper good! The decor and the vibes were also very nice, will definitely be back to try more food!

originalText.text:
We had a 1245 reservation and weren't seated until 110 so we stood there in the very crowded counter area getting bumped by bags and strollers while children were screaming and it was giving subway. It was so loud when we were seated that you have to shout to the person sitting across from you, so loud that you can't even hear the server.
The honey  butter bread was delicious not too sweet which I appreciated
I didn't love the the passion fruit  bellini
I didn't know the hot honey chicken came with a sauce on it but it was good, I don't like mixing sweet and salty but if you don't mind you'll be fine. The steak was seasoned well and the macaroni and cheese was good.
The fries were salty but good.
The coffee was bitter.
The service is excellent our server James was a super star and the food came out hot and quickly.

originalText.text:
I had brunch here and it was not very busy. There were 2 receptionists, 3 parties in front of me, everyone had a reservation but it still took a while to get everyone seated.

Service was friendly and attentive. 18% gratuity is included in the bill and our waitor was very clear about that.

Casual brunch vibe. 2 bars. Loved the drinks.

Portion is huge. The pictures I saw don't do it justice. ðŸ˜† The fried chicken bacon French toast can easily feed 2 hungry adults. This was my favorite.

Croque madame was savory, but too salty for me.

We also ordered the salmon tartar. I really enjoyed the salmon, wish the the toast was less crisp to better compliment the tartar.

We really wanted to try the chocolate layer cake but we were overstuffed.  Saved this for next time!

originalText.text: I think about this restaurant twice a day. It is just that good. Sister-restaurant to Jacobâ€™s pickles, but I prefer this one over that. Canâ€™t beat those warm honey butter buns. The challah French toast and chicken is huge. You could split it with another person and still have enough to bring home, and the leftovers are just as good! The croque madame is so, so good. I never leave without getting the pickle platter with the delicious aioli. Goodness, maybe Iâ€™ll go there today.

originalText.text:
We were very excited to try this restaurant, but sadly our experience was little underwhelming. We reserved a table for Sat lunch a day before. Upon arrival, they still needed some time to find a table for us, in a very packed restaurant. The restaurant has nice vibe, good decorative and interior. Menu is decent.

We got the chicken n honey, ham & egg, deviled eggs, mac n cheese, and some drinks. Mac n cheese, deviled egg and drinks were excellent. Didnâ€™t like the chicken n honey much, as the chicken had a very thick hard crust, and the bread was too thick. Same feeling about the ham and egg, the ham didnâ€™t have enough taste, and bulky bread just made the dish unpleasant.

Our server was very friendly. We liked the atmosphere. But the food fell short to impress us.
